description: description of the content for accessibility purposes (similar to the HTML alt attribute); formatted as for the cprt user-data item
Album title and track number for media
Name of the camera angle through which the clip was shot
Name of the collection from which the media comes
Date and time, formatted according to ISO 8601, when the content was created. For clips captured by recording devices, this is typically the date and time when the clip’s recording started.
Name of the scene for which the clip was shot
Name and version number of the software that generated this movie

"Box signaling dialogue gain for AC‑4 preselections in CMAF/ISOBMFF files.

**Technical summary**: The `diap` box (DialogueProcessingBox) extends FullBox and contains a signed 16-bit `dialog_gain` field. It represents the gain applied to the dialogue component compared to the default mix.
**Location**: `prsl/udta/diap` (child of User Data Box inside PreselectionGroupBox).

Used to differentiate preselections that share language, role and other attributes but differ in dialogue level. The `diap` box complements existing preselection metadata structures (`prsl`) and supports accessibility and personalization features in AC‑4 CMAF workflows."
